trans-unit.source: Provides data for the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
This class cannot be inherited.

The WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs class is used to supply event values to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event and to enable you to specify a custom Windows identity for the current request.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property of the WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs object supplied to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.

If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.User%2A> property during the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the Windows identity supplied by IIS is used as the identity for the current request.

If IIS uses anonymous authentication, then the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.

The **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event is raised only when the authentication <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection.Mode%2A> is set to <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationMode> and the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> is an active HTTP module for the application.
Initializes a newly created instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
The Windows identity object.
The context for the event.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> provides access to <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Request%2A>, <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Response%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> objects for the current request.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
Gets the Windows identity passed to the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs"></xref> constructor.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationModule> constructs a <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs> object using the Windows identity supplied by IIS and the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> and passes it to the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event.
If IIS uses anonymous authentication, the Identity property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
The Windows identity passed to the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs"></xref> constructor.
Gets or sets the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object to be associated with the current request.
You can use the User property to set the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.User%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> to a custom <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object.
If you do not specify a value for the User property during the **WindowsAuthentication_OnAuthenticate** event, the Windows identity supplied by IIS is used as the identity for the current request.

If IIS uses anonymous authentication, then the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsAuthenticationEventArgs.Identity%2A> property is set to the identity returned by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity.GetAnonymous%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal> object to be associated with the current request.
